titleStmt.title: Know all men by these presents, that wee Thomas Walsingham, William Wythines, and Henrie Snelgar, knights, William Style, Lambert Cooke, and Iohn Vaighan, esquires, iustices of the peace of our soueraigne lord the King, within the countie of Kent, haue admitted, licensed and allowed [blank] of [blank] within the said countie [blank] to keepe a common-ale-house ...
titleStmt.author: Kent (England)

titleStmt.title: Know all men by these presents, that wee Thomas Walsingham, William Wythines, and Henrie Snelgar, knights, William Style, Lambert Cooke, and Iohn Vaighan, esquires, iustices of the peace of our soueraigne lord the King, within the countie of Kent, haue admitted, licensed and allowed [blank] of [blank] within the said countie [blank] to keepe a common-ale-house ...
titleStmt.author: Kent (England)
Walsingham, Thomas, Sir, 1568-1630.

notesStmt.note: Blank form of license for alehouses, with 12 unnumbered articles to be observed.
Reproduction of original in: Society of Antiquaries.
